title.rendered: Babar Azam shares thoughts with the team

content.rendered:
Pakistan into the semi-final, playing against New Zealand

After three weeks of high-octane crashes and many upsets at the cricket ground, the World Cup is finally set to reach the all-important final on 13 November 2022 at the legendary Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). won four candidates. Pakistan was devastated after losing to Zimbabwe, but when South Africa lost to the Netherlands, the doors opened for Pakistan to face New Zealand on 9 November 2022.

Pakistan captain Babar Azam praised his teammates after Pakistan defeated Bangladesh in a five-wicket match, effectively making it into the quarter-finals after South Africa lost to the Netherlands earlier in the day.

The Proteas match result opened the door for Pakistan and Bangladesh to qualify as one of two teams joining India to advance to the Group 2 semi-finals. In the end, it was Pakistan who won thanks to some decent shots and great bowling. They will play New Zealand on Wednesday and advance to the final next Sunday.

“We had faith. We had a little light and played to make sure we reached the semi-finals today. There was excitement and tension but it didn’t affect our performance. No matter what happens, 100 euros must be donated. We must maintain the performance we showed in the last two games. Whatever a particular person’s job is, they should do it,” Babar said in a video shared by Pakistan Cricket’s Twitter handle.

Mohammad Harris, who hit a quickfire 31 on just 18 pitches, received special praise from the Pakistani skipper. “Great Harris. Little things like this give you confidence. When you finish the game your confidence level is another level. I did.

“Overall, Masha Allah, the bowler was great. Well done,” Babar said to cheers in the dressing room. ” he said before saying goodbye.

Read Also: Virat Kohli is the ICC Men’s Player for October 2022
